newsitem.title: PERU: Peru central bank lowers reserve requirements.
newsitem.headline: Peru central bank lowers reserve requirements.

text.p: The Central Reserve Bank of Peru reduced to seven percent from nine percent the minimum reserve requirement for private banks on which no interest is paid.
The measure, announced Tuesday in government daily El Peruano, applies to all Peru's 23 private banks.

The banks are obliged to deposit seven percent of sol deposits in the central bank, which pays no interest on that amount. The banks are also required to place 45 percent of their dollar deposits in the central bank, with interest now paid on 38 percent of this.
The new measure also reduced the interest rate on dollar deposits in the central bank to LIBOR minus 1.375 percent from LIBOR minus 1.125 percent.
The private institutions had been pressuring the central bank to eliminate or reduce tminimum reserve requirements, arguing they were too costly.
